text:
*Clarity mounting medium that doesn't cost the world?*

I'm thinking of imaging some CLARITY-cleared brains (from a user) and I was wondering if there is a cheaper option for immersion and RI matching than the CLARITY mounting media or FocusClear.

I was thinking of using TDE (thiodiethanol) or the same immersion oil I use for CUBIC (Type FF), but I'm unsure if that would be suitable from a miscibility perspective? They have the right RI though.
